definition: to appear to be/to seem as if

sentences.english: Quick question, I think people are curious to know what the city residence can benefit from this new campus.
sentences.chinese: 貌似大家都比较关心民众能从新园区中受益吗？

sentences.english: It looks like the world could be a much hotter place by the end of the century.
sentences.chinese: 貌似到本世纪末地球上温度会比现在高很多。

sentences.english: They connect us even after it seems like the ties should be broken.
sentences.chinese: 即使貌似理应断裂，仍旧藕断丝连。

sentences.english: But small amount anti-freeze was added to it. And that seem to solve the problem.
sentences.chinese: 但是加入了一些防冻剂，这貌似可以解决这个问题了。

sentences.english: Seems Charlie's in hot water…And she's about to get burned.
sentences.chinese: 查莉貌似陷入水深火热，马上要引火上身了。

sentences.english: Frankly, I probably knew vaguely about March Madness before?
sentences.chinese: 老实说，我貌似也知道以前的大学生篮球联赛？

sentences.english: Cowperthwaite gave two plausible reasons for such efforts.
sentences.chinese: 郭伯伟对此类政策给出了两个貌似可信的理由。

sentences.english: It's six songs were like to--but unlike--anything the band had done before.
sentences.chinese: 专辑的六首歌曲貌似却又不似乐队从前做过的任何歌。

sentences.english: My 21 years ago, are seemingly foolish to take the blind live.
sentences.chinese: 我的前21年貌似都在冒傻气的瞎活。

sentences.english: Friedmann said that seemingly legitimate parties also exploited loopholes.
sentences.chinese: 弗里德曼表示，貌似合法的机构也常常钻漏洞。

sentences.english: Great states like California and Illinois appear about to go belly-up. The U.
sentences.chinese: 像加利福尼亚和伊利诺斯这样的大洲貌似快破产了。

sentences.english: Measles cases seem to be everywhere in the camps, too.
sentences.chinese: 貌似在难民营里麻诊病患也是随处可见。

sentences.english: We murmur alike reproachfully rolling sands and drift, knowing not why.
sentences.chinese: 我们貌似低语却在申斥滚石漂移，不知道累。

sentences.english: But it seems like it's definitely a different model than the law school.
sentences.chinese: 但貌似它的模式和我们法学院截然不同。

sentences.english: Plot Device seems to be the true killer of many of the fan-favorites.
sentences.chinese: 情节设置貌似才是杀逝世许多粉丝最爱角色的真凶。

sentences.english: They seemed barbarians, and they were saviours .
sentences.chinese: 他们貌似蛮族，却都是救世主。

definition: contrary to what one might expect/actually/contrariwise/why don't you
only/merely/nothing but/no more than/it's just that ...
returning to our main topic,.../that said,.../again,.../in this connection/in passing/nevertheless,.../anyhow
to speak the truth/truth to tell/frankly
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
modal particle indicating that sth is obvious/particle indicating a pause for emphasis
seemingly/apparently/looks as if/appear to be/gives the impression that/seems on the face of it to be
after all/all in all/when all is said and done/in the final analysis
It is said that ... (at the start of a narrative)/to discuss/to recount
